goalDescription: Check Whether a number is Even or Odd.

blocks.domainModelQuestion: What is the goal of the block of code (line 4)?
blocks.logicalStep: It declares a variable to store a number to check whether it is odd or even.
blocks.programModelQuestion: Can you explain in detail how the goal of the current block of code (line 4) is actually implemented?
blocks.logicalStepDetail: A variable num of integer type is declared to store the number to be checked whether is even or odd. The variable num is initialized to the integer value 9.

questions.question: Why is variable num declared and what is its data type?
questions.answer: A variable num of integer type is declared to store the number to be checked whether is even or odd.

questions.question: What value is the variable num initialized to?
questions.answer: The variable num is initialized to the integer value 9.

blocks.domainModelQuestion: What is the goal of the block of code (line 6-line 9)?
blocks.logicalStep: It performs a test to check if the number is even or odd and prints the result.
blocks.programModelQuestion: Can you explain in detail how the goal of the current block of code (line 6-line 9) is actually implemented?
blocks.logicalStepDetail: To check whether a number is even or odd, the remainder of the number divisible by 2 is calculated using the remainder % operator. The number is even if the remainder is 0, otherwise, it is odd. In this case, the program prints "9 is odd".

questions.question: How does the code check whether the number is even or odd?
questions.answer: To check whether a number is even or odd, the remainder of the number divisible by 2 is calculated using the remainder % operator.

questions.question: When is the number even or odd based on the remainder operation's result?
questions.answer: The number is even if the remainder is 0, otherwise, it is odd.

questions.question: What is printed to the standard output when num is 9?
questions.answer: In this case, the program prints "9 is odd".
